public abstract class AbstractModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements Model, ModelListener, VariableListener, StatisticList, MPISerializable

A model that brings together a number of model components

Version:

Alexei Drummond, Andrew Rambaut

modelChangedEvent

public final void modelChangedEvent(Model model,
                                    java.lang.Object object,
                                    int index)
Description copied from interface: ModelListener
The model has changed. The model firing the event can optionally supply a reference to an object and an index if appropriate. Use of this extra information will be contingent on recognising what model it was that fired the event.

Specified by:
modelChangedEvent in interface ModelListener

modelRestored

public void modelRestored(Model model)
Description copied from interface: ModelListener
The model has been restored. Required only for notification of non-models (say pure likelihoods) which depend on models.

variableChangedEvent

public final void variableChangedEvent(Variable variable,

Specified by:
variableChangedEvent in interface VariableListener

handleVariableChangedEvent

protected abstract void handleVariableChangedEvent(Variable variable,
                                                   int index,
                                                   Variable.ChangeType type)
This method is called whenever a parameter is changed.

It is strongly recommended that the model component sets a "dirty" flag and does no further calculations. Recalculation is typically done when the model component is asked for some information that requires them. This mechanism is 'lazy' so that this method can be safely called multiple times with minimal computational cost.

storeModelState

public final void storeModelState()
Description copied from interface: Model
This function should be called to store the state of the entire model. This makes the model state invalid until either an acceptModelState or restoreModelState is called.

Specified by:
storeModelState in interface Model

public final void restoreModelState()
Description copied from interface: Model
This function should be called to restore the state of the entire model.

storeState

protected abstract void storeState()
Additional state information, outside of the sub-model is stored by this call.

restoreState

protected abstract void restoreState()
After this call the model is guaranteed to have returned its extra state information to the values coinciding with the last storeState call. Sub-models are handled automatically and do not need to be considered in this method.

acceptState

protected abstract void acceptState()
This call specifies that the current state is accept. Most models will not need to do anything. Sub-models are handled automatically and do not need to be considered in this method.
